creator: joseph@cs.usyd.edu.au
text:
Hello

I've this error when trying to launch ant :
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
org/apache/tools/ant/launch/Launcher

ANT is installed in /usr/local/apache-ant-1.6.1/ .

JAVA is installed in /etc/SUNWappserver/

ANT_HOME=/usr/local/apache-ant-1.6.1/bin
JAVA_HOME=/etc/SUNWappserver/jdk

I'm on a Linux debian, kernel 2.4.25-1-386.

I have looked through the web and I've found nothing to help me.

If you could help me it would be great !

Thanks
Joseph
creator: joseph@cs.usyd.edu.au

text:
First, try setting ANT_HOME to the correct value:  the same as your 
installation directory, preferably minus the trailing slash.  The next thing to 
try will always be ensuring your CLASSPATH is unset; this is probably the most 
common source of conflicts in a new user setup.  This is more properly an issue 
for the user list:  user@ant.apache.org .  As such, I am closing this report.
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text:
Wait a sec- I've been getting about the same problem.  
How do you solve it?
creator: jwozniak@nd.edu

text:
As I said before, it is a question for the userlist.  For good measure, I 
answered it here anyway.  Did you take the steps I advised?
creator: mbenson@apache.org
jwozniak@nd.edu
text:
Ok, I just can't get it working.  I have this: 

Slim: /usr/local/ant> echo $ANT_HOME ; echo $JAVA_HOME ; echo $CLASSPATH
/usr/local/ant
/usr/local/j2sdk1.4.2_04
CLASSPATH: Undefined variable.
Slim: /usr/local/ant> ls $ANT_HOME
bin   etc   lib      LICENSE.dom  LICENSE.xerces  README  welcome.html
docs  KEYS  LICENSE  LICENSE.sax  NOTICE          TODO    WHATSNEW
Slim: /usr/local/ant> ls $JAVA_HOME
bin        demo     install.log  lib      man     README.html 
THIRDPARTYLICENSEREADME.txt
COPYRIGHT  include  jre          LICENSE  README  src.zip      _uninst
Slim: /usr/local/ant> bin/ant
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/apache/tools/ant/launch/Launcher
Slim: /usr/local/ant>

creator: joseph@cs.usyd.edu.au
text:
Thanks for the tips, it works.

Cheers,
 Joseph

I did what Matt Benson told and it works. Thanks again and sorry for the 
incorrect bug report.
creator: joseph@cs.usyd.edu.au

text:
Holy jeez - I fixed it.  

My /etc/ant.conf left over from ant 1.5 was screwing it up.
creator: jwozniak@nd.edu
